station.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a place where trains or buses regularly stop so that passengers can get on and off, goods can be loaded etc, or the buildings at such a place
station.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: I want to get off at the next station.
Is there a waiting room in the station?
station.translation[0].definitions[1].si: centre for a service or activity
station.translation[0].definitions[1].de: a building or place that is a centre for a particular kind of service or activity
station.translation[0].definitions[1].no: polling station (=where you vote in an election)
station.translation[0].definitions[2].de: an organization which makes television or radio broadcasts, or the building where this is done
station.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Karen was definitely getting ideas above her station (=higher than her social rank).
station.translation[0].definitions[4].de: a place where someone stands or sits in order to be ready to do something quickly if needed
station.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: You’re not to leave your station unless told.
station.translation[0].definitions[5].de: a large sheep or cattle farm in Australia or New Zealand
station.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: station
a place where trains or buses regularly stop
The town has its own railway station.
Paddington Station in west London
the bus station
terminus
the station or stop at the end of a railway or bus line
We’ve arranged to meet her at the Victoria bus terminus.
the railway terminus in central Calcutta
track
the metal lines along which trains travel. This is sometimes used in American English to say which part of a station a train will leave from
The passenger train, traveling at 120 mph, careered off the tracks.
platform
the raised place beside a railway track where you get on and off a train in a station – used especially to say which part of a station a train will leave from
Trains for Oxford leave from Platform 2.
ticket office
the place at a station where tickets are sold
You can buy rail tickets online or at the ticket office.
departures board
a board saying when and from which part of a station each train will leave
The departures board said that the train was ten minutes late.
station.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to send someone in the military to a particular place for a period of time as part of their military duty
station.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: I was stationed overseas at the time.
station.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to move to a particular place and stand or sit there, especially in order to be able to do something quickly, or to cause someone to do this
station.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: A security guard was stationed near the door.
